pull_request.title: [hotfix] Updated c++17 compiler flags
pull_request.body: Building the extentions of ColossalAI with Pytorch 2.1 requires c++17. Related installation files are fixed to support this by adding `-std=c++17`.

issue.title: [Inference] Dynamic Batching Inference, online and offline
issue.body:
## 📌 Checklist before creating the PR

- [ ] I have created an issue for this PR for traceability
- [x] The title follows the standard format: `[doc/gemini/tensor/...]: A concise description`
- [ ] I have added relevant tags if possible for us to better distinguish different PRs


## 🚨 Issue number

> Link this PR to your issue with words like fixed to automatically close the linked issue upon merge
>
> e.g. `fixed #1234`, `closed #1234`, `resolved #1234`



## 📝 What does this PR do?

> Summarize your work here.
> if you have any plots/diagrams/screenshots/tables, please attach them here.
This PR adds a new feature for colossal inference, dynamic batching, it supports online(with ray serve) and offline (merge inputs into a big batch and returns a generator).

## 💥 Checklist before requesting a review

issue.title: [BUG]: colossalai cannot be installed using the source code
issue.body:
### 🐛 Describe the bug

Follow these steps to install colossalai
git clone https://github.com/hpcaitech/ColossalAI.git
cd ColossalAI
pip install -r requirements/requirements.txt
CUDA_EXT=1 pip install .

the error is
`Allowing ninja to set a default number of workers... (overridable by setting the environment variable MAX_JOBS=N)
      1.11.1.git.kitware.jobserver-1
      g++ -pthread -B /home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/compiler_compat -shared -Wl,-rpath,/home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/lib -Wl,-rpath-link,/home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/lib -L/home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/lib -Wl,-rpath,/home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/lib -Wl,-rpath-link,/home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/lib -L/home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/lib /home/pdl/xlz/ColossalAI/build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-310/home/pdl/xlz/ColossalAI/colossalai/kernel/cuda_native/csrc/cpu_adam.o -L/home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/lib/python3.10/site-packages/torch/lib -L/usr/local/cuda/lib64 -lc10 -ltorch -ltorch_cpu -ltorch_python -lcudart -lc10_cuda -ltorch_cuda_cu -ltorch_cuda_cpp -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-cpython-310/colossalai/_C/cpu_adam.cpython-310-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
      g++: error: /home/pdl/xlz/ColossalAI/build/temp.linux-x86_64-cpython-310/home/pdl/xlz/ColossalAI/colossalai/kernel/cuda_native/csrc/cpu_adam.o: 没有那个文件或目录
      error: command '/usr/bin/g++' failed with exit code 1
      [end of output]
  
  note: This error originates from a subprocess, and is likely not a problem with pip.
  ERROR: Failed building wheel for colossalai
  Running setup.py clean for colossalai
Failed to build colossalai
ERROR: Could not build wheels for colossalai, which is required to install pyproject.toml-based projects`

### Environment

cuda_11.7  
cuDNN 8904
nccl (2, 14, 3)
python 3.10
torch 1.13.1

commits.message:
[Pipeline inference] Combine kvcache with pipeline inference (#4938)

* merge kvcache with pipeline inference and refactor the code structure

* support ppsize > 2

* refactor pipeline code

* do pre-commit

* modify benchmark

* fix bench mark

* polish code

* add docstring and update readme

* refactor the code

* fix some logic bug of ppinfer

* polish readme

* fix typo

* skip infer test

issue.body:

when i run bash gemini.sh in /ColossalAI/examples/language/llama2/scripts/benchmark_7B
the error is
`Model params: 6.28 B
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/lib/python3.10/site-packages/colossalai/kernel/op_builder/builder.py", line 161, in load
    op_module = self.import_op()
  File "/home/pdl/anaconda3/envs/xlz/lib/python3.10/site-packages/colossalai/kernel/op_builder/builder.py", line 109, in import_op
    return importlib.import_module(self.prebuilt_import_path)

    return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)

issue.title: [BUG]: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'colossalai.context.parallel_mode'
issue.body:
### 🐛 Describe the bug

Hello !

I tried to run train.sh for FastFold https://github.com/hpcaitech/FastFold, but I got such errors:

Could you help me pls?
colossalai                0.3.3                    pypi_0    pypi


```
/opt/conda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.8/site-packages/colossalai/kernel/cuda_native/mha/flash_attn_2.py:21: UserWarning: FlashAttention only supports Ampere GPUs or newer.                                     warnings.warn("FlashAttention only supports Ampere GPUs or newer.")
/opt/conda/envs/pytorch/lib/python3.8/site-packages/colossalai/kernel/cuda_native/mha/flash_attn_2.py:28: UserWarning: please install flash_attn from https://github.com/HazyResearch/flash-attention
  warnings.warn("please install flash_attn from https://github.com/HazyResearch/flash-attention")
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 11, in <module>
    from fastfold.utils.inject_fastnn import inject_fastnn
  File "/FastFold/fastfold/utils/inject_fastnn.py", line 17, in <module>
    from fastfold.model.fastnn import EvoformerStack, ExtraMSAStack

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'colossalai.context.parallel_mode'


ERROR:torch.distributed.elastic.multiprocessing.api:failed (exitcode: 1) local_rank: 0 (pid: 144182) of binary: /opt/conda/envs/pytorch/bin/python
Traceback (most recent call last):

    sys.exit(load_entry_point('torch==1.12.0', 'console_scripts', 'torchrun')())
```

issue.title: [DOC]: Question about Colossal-LLaMA-2
issue.body:
### 📚 The doc issue

I want to continue pretraining llama2 with my own domain data. My data are about 1 billion tokens. To avoid catastrophic forgetting, we should add some pretraining data. But Meta don't release pretraining data. In Colossal-LLaMA-2 readme doc, there is a Knowledge replay stage:

>Knowledge is replayed through a question-answering (QA) mechanism, encompassing both the Chinese and English domains.

Could you tell me the detail of this step and which dataset do you use? Thank you.

comment.body: Hi, `colossalai.context.parallel_model` has been deprecated and moved to legacy in the newest version of ColossalAI (it can be imported through `colossalai.legacy.context.parallel_model`). Downgrade ColossalAI to older version (below 0.3.0) should solve this issue.

issue.title: [BUG]: Parameter `model.norm.weight` failed at the gradient reduction.
issue.body:

My launch script:

```
colossalai run --nproc_per_node 8   train.py \
    --pretrained /nas/lili/models_hf/13B-chat \
    --dataset "/nas/lili/colossalaitest/Colossal-LLaMA-2/spliced_tokenized_output_arrow/part-00000" \
    --plugin "gemini" \
    --save_interval 400 \
    --save_dir "13b_rv" \
    --tensorboard_dir tbdir \
    --config_file config-13b.json \
    --num_epochs 1 \
    --micro_batch_size 1 \
    --lr 1e-4 \
    --mixed_precision "bf16" \
    --grad_clip 1.0 \
    --weight_decay 0.01 \
    --warmup_steps 100 \
    --use_grad_checkpoint \
    --use_flash_attn
```

### Environment

cuda 11.7
cudnn 8.9.4.25_cuda11
python 3.9
pytorch 1.13.1+cu117
colossal 0.3.3
